label: Description
value: Cravat end of Brussels-style lace with a hunter on horseback in the center, surrounded by fantastic foliage, trees and flowers, birds, a rabbit, a deer, and other animals. A figure with a spear blowing a horn in the lower right corner, and two figures carrying birds? in the upper left.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, Brussels style Label: linen bobbin lace

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes in her memory

label: Description
value: Symmetrical scrolls in gold on cut velvet in red.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: appliqué on velvet

label: Description
value: The design is composed of two alternating stripes. The wider one has small sprays of roses bowknotted together by a wide ribbon streamer. The narrow stripe is a vertical reeded molding. Printed in white, red and green on natural gray skin paper.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Imperial Paper and Color Corporation

label: Description
value: Rectangles and diagonal squares are placed in alternating rows with smaller circular medallions between. Each medallion is filled with figures in classic garb similar to Wedgwood's Jasperware. Probably inspired from designs of Robert Adam. Each medallion is framed with an ornamental border. Fine floral scrolls cover the entire background. Tiny birds are perched on the twigs. Printed on margin: "Lisieres Fleuries." Background is striped. Entire paper is embossed in fine parallel vertical lines.

label: Provenance
value: Found in the Pingree House, Salem, Massachusetts.

label: Description
value: Symmetrical design inspired from damask pattern. Bouquets of roses in alternating rows. Acanthus leaves encircle them. Entire paper is embossed to simulate a coarse weave such as monk's cloth. Printed on margin: "U.S.A. 3780, trim." Printed in soft pastel colors on deep cream background which simulates stipple work.
Lapis Polaris Magnes (Invention of the Compass), plate 2 of the Nova Reperta (New Inventions for Modern Times)

label: Description
value: An old man, identified as the legendary Flavio Amalfitano, seated at his desk using a compass and reading a book; tools, books, and instruments are arranged around the richly furnished room; a dog is at his feet. A model of a ship hangs above and in front of him.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Samuel P. Avery

label: Description
value: Knotted cords attached to diamond-shaped panel formed of braided cord; loop at end of one cord; end of other cord fringed.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: maguey fibers Technique: braided Label: braided maguey fiber

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Marie Torrance Hadden

label: Description
value: Netted panel with a pattern of parallel zigzag lines, with two strings attched.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: maguey fiber Technique: single element knotted net Label: maguey fiber knotted net

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Marie Torrance Hadden

label: Description
value: Design of detached floral motifs and rings arranged in rows on ground quilted in a lozenge design. Motifs have three different designs, but each one shows a curving stem with flowers and leaves. Embroidery is in brown, red, pink, yellow and green. The panel is made up of two pieces sewed together horizontally.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, linen Technique: satin stitch embroidery on plain weave

label: Description
value: Wool damask in an orange and green floral pattern.

label: Description
value: Embroidered panel in three different designs arranged in bands: one showing alternating knots and four petal flowers in drop repeats; the second, vertically placed leaf forms crossed by a line with S-shaped ornaments; the third, lozenges and crosses. Worked in pink, blue, yellow and green silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: counted stitch embroidery, cross and stem stitches
